p.s: Description of Nocardioides marinus sp. nov.
Nocardioides marinus (ma.ri′nus. L. masc. adj. marinus referring to the sea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are rods (about 1.0–1.8 μm long and 0.4–0.6 μm wide) in the exponential phase and coccus forms are found in the stationary phase.
Cells are non-motile and strictly aerobic.
Colonies on MA are circular, smooth, convex with an entire margin and creamy white.
Substrate or aerial mycelium is not observed.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C (optimum about 25–30 °C) and at pH values of 6–9 (optimum pH 7–8).
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations of 0.5–8 % (w/v) (optimum 1–3 %).

Negative in tests for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease and gelatinase, and positive for aesculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase in API 20NE tests.
Casein and Tween 80 are hydrolysed, but hypoxanthine, xanthine, l-tyrosine and starch are not.
Cell-wall diamino acid is ll-diaminopimelic acid.
The major fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0 (71.5 %) and 10-methyl C17 : 0 (5.1 %).
Results of API ZYM and carbon source utilization tests are given in Table 1.
The DNA G+C content is 72.9 mol%.
The type strain, CL-DD14T (=KCCM 42321T=DSM 18248T), was isolated from seawater of the East Sea, Korea.
